eu.cqse.check.abap

Class HardCodedPasswordCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
      • eu.cqse.check.abap.HardCodedLiteralsCheckBase
        • eu.cqse.check.abap.HardCodedPasswordCheck

  • @ACheck(name="Hard-coded password",
        description="<p>Hard-coded passwords should be avoided, since hard-coded credentials like user name or password are a potential security risk. Anybody who has access to the source code (regardless if on the development or production system) would be able to read the password.</p>",
        groupName="Security",
        languages=ABAP,
        defaultEnablement=YELLOW,
        parameters=ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_TREE)
public class HardCodedPasswordCheck
extends HardCodedLiteralsCheckBase
    Checks for hard-coded user names. The check searches for occurrences of character literals which occur in context of an identifier which is may indicate the it stores a user name, e.g. variables named like 'user_name', 'user', 'sys_uname', ...
